pageTitle: Heat at Grizzlies - April 9, 2014 - Game Preview, Play by Play, Scores and Recap on NBA.com
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {11388=Randolph had 25 points and 14 rebounds against Miami on March 21, but the Heat finished the game on a 14-2 run to beat the Grizzlies 91-86 at home., 14625=The teams were tied at 91 after Lewis' 3-pointer was topped with a foul when Gasol bumped him. The ensuing free throw tied the game with 5:43 left., 20890=NOTABLE: The Heat were playing without guard Dwyane Wade (strained left hamstring), Udonis Haslem (stomach virus), Chris Andersen (flu), and Greg Oden (back spasms). ... This was just the 15th loss for the Heat against a Western Conference opponent since the start of last season. During that span, they are no 46-15 against the Western Conference. ... Since Dec. 28, the Grizzlies are 9-0 against teams coming to FedExForum on the second night of a back-to-back. ... Miami started the game on fire from 3-point range, making nine of their first 10 3-pointers. They finished the game canning 15 of 25, which tied for their second-most made in a game this season. Lewis was 4 of 6 from behind the arc, while James and Shane Battier both were 3 of 5. ... The Grizzlies outscored Miami in the paint, 60-30, and out-rebounded the smaller Heat, 41-27. ... Despite the win, the Grizzlies remained in the ninth spot in the Western Conference standings, a game behind Phoenix, which won at New Orleans Wednesday night., 158679=Copyright © 2015 NBA Media Ventures, LLC.
